meanings.definition: To provide with a star or stars.
meanings.sent1: She will bestar the sky for the party tonight.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will bestar the students who did well on the test.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to bestar the cake with edible stars.
meanings.sent4: The night sky bestarred with twinkling lights, like a magical blanket.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to bestar the canvas with a sprinkle of stardust.

meanings.definition: To set or adorn with stars.
meanings.sent1: He plans to bestar his room with glow-in-the-dark stars.
meanings.sent2: The designer will bestar the dress with shimmering sequins.
meanings.sent3: The prankster decided to bestar his friend's car with star stickers.
meanings.sent4: The night sky bestarred with a million diamonds, a celestial masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The stage was bestarred with lights, making the performance truly shine.
